title: Bring back teemos E.
body:
He's just so underwhelming after all the changes (specially with the changes to adcs getting universally more damage/abilities etc)  he can't assassinate anyone at any point, even with the best ambush set up possible unless he's incredibly far ahead (and in which case nearly anyone can do it or better).

Bring his E back to something you can't ignore in lane.

replies.body: We always have our eyes on Teemo.  Mainly just to see if he's looking back. I don't think he's in a terrible place, but I was honestly surprised the 6.1 changes didn't feel better for him.  Always run into a couple of deep questions when I play him: do I want to win lane phase, or survive it?  Do I want to be cute (Cottontail) or deadly (Omega Squad)?  Sometimes the burden of these questions is too hard to overcome and I lose because of it.  I'll make sure he remains in our conversations on this end. ;)

I'm glad to see that Teemo is being looked at. It is true that he is considered "unfun" to lane against; however, these days I just wonder where Teemo exactly fits in within the game. Whenever I choose him in ranked games, many just feel the need to point out that Teemo is a weak choice for top or any other lane for that matter. He's a marksman that doesn't exactly do well in the botlane, but he also has to play very safely as an assassin for his secondary category; yet, he is more likely to be assassinated first before finishing off an opponent due to his linear kit.

Though the shroom tossing was a welcoming addition to his team fight abilities. I do wish his escape (W) provided more options for him such as a mushroom bouncing active which may detonate a shroom if he runs over it while activating his W, but allows him to jump much like Ziggs' W. It might provide him a chance to escape while also dashing through bushes for an escape. As a swift scout, his small movement speed burst just doesn't provide enough for him to escape ganks and whatnot.

Definitely feel like you have to pressure hard to take advantage of lane, and then you open yourself up to ganks. Then again, sometimes I'm just losing 1v1 to Fiora or the like. :(  

I haven't learned to use the brush portion of the passive particularly well yet. I used to super rarely use his passive but I can definitely see it being a lot more viable dancing in the brush as opposed to standing still.
The new minion aggro changes were a pretty big hidden nerf to his aggressive play-style.

This is part of why I strongly feel that Teemo should get some buffs that specifically help him play as a Jungler. I feel like he's built for ganking and controlling objectives, both things that a Jungler is meant to do.

I think he has actually lost abit of his 3-4 minute get ganked time, With the improved Storm raider's Surge . The movement speed boost with 70% resistance makes his all in's incredibly more deadly well also able to speed boost away from being attacked I feel

Thank you so much for responding to this. Although I have no experience with teemo personally, I do enjoy watching Ivan Pavlov's stream on a regular basis. I would honestly go through him on this topic.

hey Riot SOTEREB0SS ,any plans for aatrox ? jarvan? they`re pretty `dead` ,and jarvan has map specific nerfs which lower his normal playstyle even more/power.
We've talked about both of them needing a little love, but we don't have anything in testing right at this instance.

I'll be completely honest. I like where teemo is right now. 

I would like perhaps an ever so slight base damage buff to e and perhaps a couple changes to w. Perhaps a tiny boost to the movespeed later (mainly thinking scaling 10% to 30% instead of 10-26) or a partial/full reset on the cooldown when he gets a kill/assist.

I don't do ap teemo much so i can't speak on his health in that regard. Mostly because a majority of mid lane matchups are either assassins, which destroy teemo, or long range mages and shit which will just poke me down. I don't enjoy ap teemo outside of mid as much as i do ad/onhit/slightlytanky teemo.

If you want to do something with teemo i don't want that kind of build to be discouraged in favor of AP. I'd like to see both be viable.

Also teemo can be a pain to lane against but even champions he "counters" can still beat him. Nasus for example just kind of rushes spirit visage and now teemo can't do anything. Darius can kill teemo over and over again once he hits 6. And yet looking at a place like champion.gg some of the champions that "counter" teemo i would actually willingly pick teemo against. Those are few and far between but among them are gnar, which i love playing against as teemo, and tahm kench, which i feel teemo is one of the few champions that can actually beat a tahm in lane. For most of the other matchups there aren't enough games to get an accurate idea as to who counters who. Like i would play teemo against zac and warwick even though they "counter" teemo based on this but there are only 40 games between the 2 of them (at the elos that champion.gg looks at) so it is no where near accurate. Infact there are 3 matchups with more than 500 games top and only 3 matchups over 100 games in mid.

I find it to be interesting that teemo exists in a state where looking at some statistics he isn't that good and yet i know from experience on the champion how good he can be and yet how he can be dealt with in lane. I always feel like that if people put time into the champion then it would invalidate most of the statistics that exist on him, and yet I also know that he has a low pick rate and the people that do play him do it because they know what they are doing on the champion and play it a lot.

I feel it's his W that really needs to be looked at. It's very.. underwhelming.. worst yet the fact even playing the champ you become a massive target. It's not fun being camped always when playing him.
he just needs higher scalings. hes an auto attacker. any adc outdamages him late game. and his range is low.

his w should allow him to hop on his shroom and bounce away(distance inscrease with the same rate as his ult shroom bounce)

(maybe with a cd or something so he can't just make a path full of shroom and bounce ad eternam (even tho it would be funny to see him jump on shrooms while his ennemies are gettin slowly killed by them))

Buff teemo so all melee top laners instantly lose lane?

Fuck that.
his E used to be a 0.6 ratio with his ap, now it's like what 0.2?

The tweak to allow stealth with brush movement was a very nice and effective QOL tweak which allows him to dive through the brushes for slipperiness and easy attack rate bonuses. Not sure if attack rate is the most ideal bonus however, but the stat is something I value on him with how powerful his E actually can be... It was always really hard to take advantage of his passive in lane before in a skilled setting; not so much anymore tho

I think if Teemo's ult costed slightly less mana especially at later ranks {{item:3115}} would easily be core and he might even be a competitive niche rather than just a fun pick.

Now IDK if it's just me but his AP ratios seem lowish so I always forgo {{item:3089}} , putting more value on Lichbane or Void Staff always... That's fine because I hate saving soo much gold for that thing and enjoy the utilities other ap items have on the side

I don't really value {{item:3151}} , the effect never seemed that pronounced to me to be worth a slot... I've always felt I have to build him with either lichbane or nashor's to give him some bite to his burst or dps in teamfights (both is an option). It's also important to build him brawny sometimes too so Rylias & abyssal/zhonyas are most useful...

Teemo's skill order can vary on his opponent's tankiness and kill pressure. Q is more poke/burst and safer. This is often the way to go versus mages and melee carries for blind duration. E is for dps versus very tanky types. The style is fun but more dangerous in general but effective for doing a lot of damage in one fight. I will then often build to accommodate my skill order choice. Sheen for Q style or stinger for E style.

Right now the Q max poke style is easier to play, and less niche... Now I don't want to lose having options here, I feel having choices adds a lot of depth to the game, but I also feel like pressing Q to blind your opponent and chunk is a cheesy playstyle.
